emuInput.TitMainTitle: Children enacting traffic court on stage, with boy standing at Judge's bench, and girls and boys wearing crossing guard sashes seated on left, in McKelvey or Miller School
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 18, 1947, pg. 2, reads: "Guilty? - Students of McKelvey School conduct one of their Traffic Court sessions which have been mainly responsible for the lack of accidents in Miller School, according to Dr. Louis Kalassey, principal. Intelligent instruction in the rules of traffic and precautionary measures has resulted in Miller School winning the green safety pennant. The children conduct the court with regular courtroom procedure and every legal angle is rigidly observed. The school has been including the Traffic Court in its curriculum since October. - Harris Photo."
